fields.description:
I am trying to export incidents to excel but excel wont load? I am sure it did in previous releases...
Also is it possible for export to show more fields? I would like to customise the output as well as the search criteria. This is quite key for our reporting.

thx,
Geoff Urbach
fields.summary: export to excel doesnt load excel?

fields.description:
When an issue is reopened and with a comment the comment doesn't display straight away.  When the issue is updated again then the comments are shown.

I think this is to do with the issue cache not being flush properly.  Will try to recreate in a test environment.
fields.summary: Comments don't always show

fields.description: When you resolve and close and issue you are shown the closed issue.  It would be nice if the user could pick to go back to the IssueNavigator instead of the current issue.
fields.summary: Where to go on Issue Close?

fields.description:
- Don't let me see the "admin portlet" select radio button if i'm not in the admin group (I know it says "you can't use if admin", but if i can't use, why let me select)

- Show thumbnails on the "Add Portlet" page, so I can get a little preview of what the content may look like

- When adding new portlets, the default should be to put it at the bottom of my portlet config, and let me reorganize it, not add it to the top

- The "User Issues" portlet is confusing.  I know what it is, and I'm used to it... but.  Perhaps renamed "Quick Links: User" or something else?
fields.summary: Misc dashboard improvements

fields.description:
The "dashboard configuration" link seems a bit buried being all the way on the bottom left of the profile page.

Perhaps at the bottom of the dashboard provide a "Configure Dashboard" link?  Not sure... but somehow incorporate an edit button on the homepage.
fields.summary: Add "configure dashboard" link to dashboard itself

fields.description:
When you edit a filter, you lose the sort order.

Replication steps:
- load a saved filter
- set a sort order (ie date created desc)
- edit one of the fields
- the sort order is now reset

Sort order should be maintained when editing a filter.
fields.summary: Sort order lost editing filter

fields.description:
Couple of things...

In the configuration screen I saw "User Issues" on both the left and right side. I moved the one on the left over to the right and then the list on the right showed "User Issues" twice. When I moved (or was it delete, crap, I forgot) one of them back, I got:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.portal.PortalPageConfigurationImpl.movePortletPositionColumn(PortalPageConfigurationImpl.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.user.ConfigurePortal.doMoveColumnButton(ConfigurePortal.java:214)

fields.summary: Dashboard Configuration errors

fields.description: See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: New Dashboard does wacky stuff

fields.description: It basically threw the java.lang.OutOfMemoryError when doing export.
fields.summary: Export threw java.lang.OutOfMemoryError when > 10,000 users in system.

fields.description:
First Time Poster: 

In evaluating JIRA 2.0 EAP 6; I was setting up different user groups and assigning / modifying permissions among the different groups. 

Somehow, I have gotten into a state where I cannot login under the admin user or regular users. I get the message "Sorry, your username and password are incorrect - please try again."

If I go through the routine of having JIRA email me a new password, I still cannot login to the system even with the new password. 

I have a feeling I have goofed up my user permissions / groups so that no one can log in. 

Any suggestions?
fields.summary: Can't Login as admin or any user:

fields.description: After adding 10,000 users to the system  (how I did it, you asked??  I wrote an extra servlet to bypass the security checks, etc...) , I created a project named 'AAA', created two user groups named 'AAA_lead', 'AAA_users'.  I've added user1000 to both groups, and user1001, user1002, user1003, user1004 to group 'AAA_users'.  I then set the per-project permissions for this project to 'AAA_users' only, with the exception of 'Project Administrations', where I set it to 'AAA_lead'.  (NOTE: all entries in the global permission has been left blank to prevent overriding.)  When I tried to create a 'bug' issue in this project, there is no one listed in the 'assigned to' field!!  So, I can't assign the issue to anyone belonging to 'AAA_users'!!
fields.summary: Can't assign project issue when > 10,000 users

fields.description:
When trying to type in the German paragraph-symbol (ASCII 167) the html-code breaks and the text area contains the html-code of the following input fields. (</textarea> is missing)

I can demonstrate it for you if you like on your own system.

Once again. This bug affects a customer installation and it is important for us as a reseller that this bug will be fixed.

Best regards

Wolfgang Tank
fields.summary: encoding problem with German "paragraph"-symbol

fields.description:
Using German Umlauts within the description field works fine but when I try to use them within a comment field it fails.

As we have implemented Jira 1.4.3 for a customer we would appreciate it very much if you could fix this bug  in the specified version.

Best regards

catWorkX
Wolfgang Tank
fields.summary: Encoding problem within comments

fields.description:
there doesnt seem to be a way of finding out a users username unless you are an administrator?
would be nice to be able to search on a users first name or surname, or even a quick way to lookup a users username??
fields.summary: cannot find username via search

fields.description:
Really easy one this:

 I get jira emails to my mobile (160 chars via SMS), this is great.

 When new issues are created, I can see the summary on my phone, lovely.

 However on comments, I get something like this:

"jira@javanicus.demon.co.uk: (<javanicus> Commented:(JAV-39) Can use F4 -> F10 during the two intro screens) The following comment has been added to this iss."

when I would prefer the start of the comment instead:

"jira@javanicus.demon.co.uk: (<javanicus> Commented:(JAV-39) Can use F4 -> F10 during the two intro screens) Really important words that I need to know now!!!"

where "Really important words that I need to know now!!!" are the first few words of the actual comment.

i.e. format on SMS is <FROM>(<SUBJECT>)<MESSAGE>

* WHAT TO FIX THEN???

so the first 50 (or so) chars of an email are very important,
and shouldn't be wasted with stock phrases ;-)

anyways, this is probably as easy as changing an email template
somewhere, so get it in for v2.0 Final :-) :-) :-)

just move stock phrases after the guts of the email.

jez.

(rambling as ever, sorry)
fields.summary: Snappy email alerts
Rows in the services page do not alternate colours

fields.description:
If you add a comment, and limit it to a certain subset (eg viewable only by 'jira-developers'), and you add this comment in a reassign action (and possibly all commentable actions), then the comment is sent in the email to *all* users.

This needs to be fixed asap.
fields.summary: Comments visible to only one group are sent with issue change actions

fields.description:
Allow searching by groups, by adding a user-groups field as a lucene search.

In dropdown on issue navigator, have a new value 'Specify Group'.

This lucene parameter will also need to be flushed on any group operations.
fields.summary: Allow searching by user groups

fields.description:
Mike,

Is it possible to get a JIRA instance setup for a new Display Tag
Library project I setup at SF?  Hopefully, you'll still giving free
hosting/software to OSS projects ;-)

The project's site is at http://sf.net/projects/displaytag

The original site is at http://edhill.its.uiowa.edu/display-0.8/

We're hoping to continue development of this Tag Library as it's widely
used and the original Author is not doing any further development on it.
We've contacted him and he's on board with our efforts.

Thanks,

Matt
fields.summary: Setup DisplayTag JIRA instance

fields.description:
Via email from Paul Hill:

Message: Sometimes emails fail to be sent in a seemingly random fashion.  So far the only sign of trouble is in the velocity.log.  I have included the messages generated when a failure occurs, unfortunately I can't work out what exactly is wrong with this issue that causes the problem.   Can you help?


---------------


Mon Feb 03 14:32:07 PST 2003   [info] ResourceManager : found templates/email/includes/issuelink.vm with loader org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.loader.ClasspathResourceLoader
Mon Feb 03 14:32:07 PST 2003   [info] ResourceManager : found templates/email/includes/issuesummary.vm with loader org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.loader.ClasspathResourceLoader
Mon Feb 03 14:32:07 PST 2003  [error] Left side ($issue.getString("resolution").length()) of '!=' operation has null value. Operation not possible. templates/email/includes/issuesummary.vm [line 14, column 48]
Mon Feb 03 14:32:07 PST 2003   [info] ResourceManager : found templates/email/includes/footer.vm with loader org.apache.velocity.runtime.resource.loader.ClasspathResourceLoader


There may be other remplates with similar problems.
fields.summary: Error in velocity templates sends blank emails
Allow searching of attachments

fields.description:
Allow for easier working through issues.

An advanced feature that could be added is to page through the search results (ie next search result, previous search result).  This may take a lot more thinking however.
fields.summary: Show "next" and "previous" on bug display page

fields.description:
The version drop downs everywhere can get cluttered on a new installation.

If there are no versions defined, the boxes should be removed.

If there are no unreleased or no released versions, those lines should not appear (ie Unknown/Unreleased/Released/-V1 looks weird should be Unknown/Released/-V1).

Discussed more in JRA-1016.
fields.summary: Version drop downs

fields.description:
Excel view's summary column is incorrect.  I get things like:

" [GenericEntity:Status][description,This issue has recently been added to the assignee's list of issues and must be processed. Issues in this state may be assigned to someone else, or resolved and marked resolved.][name,Assigned][id,2][iconurl,/images/icons/status_assigned.gif][sequence,2]"

Thanks to Marc Bown for pointing this out.
fields.summary: Excel view contains incorrect summary

fields.description: When creating an issue with the trial version of JIRA I reached my limit of allowable issues. the following error was presented. You are running without an evaluation license and have created 10 issues. Get an evaluation key for 30 days unlimited use. I assume that you wanted the link to render as html. Should be a simple fix.
fields.summary: Error code contains URL HTML code, which has not rendered as an HTML link

fields.description:
* Lock people out after X incorrect logins is a way to prevent brute force attacks on passwords

* Use a dictionary to prevent insecure passwords

* Validate email addresses (similar to how they do it in scarab), by checking the MX records for validity.
fields.summary: Security and validation of email & passwords
Jabber based listener

fields.description: The "In Progress" icon is difficult to tell apart from the closed and resolved icons. Perhaps making the icon use a yellow arrow would make it easier?
fields.summary: Improve "In Progress" icon

fields.description:
I first created user with following attributes:
login: hello, password: hello, fullname: Hello World, email: hello@xxx.com

then, I deleted user 'hello'

then, I re-created the user 'hello' with the same attributes.  

When I (admin privilege) use the user browser, the fullname and the email entries have been added.

Now, stop and re-start the webapp, I did a shutdown/restart on tomcat.

When I (admin privilege) use the user browser, the fullname and the email entries have been erased!!  So, I investigate further into the persistent layer....


I looked at the exported DB XML and found the following relevant pieces:

<OSUser id="10091" name="hello" passwordHash="m3HSJL1i83hdltRq0+o9czGb+8KJDKra4t/3JRlnPKcjI8PZm6XBHXx6zG4UuMXaDEZjR1wuXDre9G9zvN7AQw=="/>
  
<OSPropertyString id="10163" value="Hello World"/>
<OSPropertyString id="10162" value="hello@xxx.com"/>

<OSPropertyEntry entityId="10090" entityName="OSUser" id="10163"
    propertyKey="fullName" type="5"/>
<OSPropertyEntry entityId="10090" entityName="OSUser" id="10162"
    propertyKey="email" type="5"/>

Apparently, when I first created the user 'hello', the OSUser id was '10090'.  The 'fullName' and the 'email' attributes were still mapping to the deleted 'hello' user.  Also, note that there is no entry of <OSUser id="10090" ..... > found anywhere in the DB XML.


so, I did a step-by-step sequence and export the DB @ each step:

after first creation: above entries were all created and consistent:
after first delete: above entries were all gone and consistent:
after 2nd creation: The <OSPropertyEntry entityId="10090" ....> entries somehow remembers that 'hello' used to be OSUser id 10090!!??

Of course, this can be an OSUser problem, maybe because of its way of doing some caching or something when doing user-id lookup.

Thanks.

-alvin
fields.summary: Re-created user has his fullname/email erased.

fields.description:
Some of our developers are getting confused with resolutions.  We have one group who creates and closes bugs, and another that works on and resolves bugs.  Developers have the ability to reassign, in case they need to send an issue to another developer.

When developers are assigned a bug, they will fix the issue and mark it as resolved.  Once resolved, they see the bug is still assigned to them, even though our QA needs to close it.  So they reassign the bug to the QA individual to close.  At this point, the issue is technically reopened.

We'd like to have the ability to "Resolve & Reassign", which doesn't change the STATUS, but DOES change the assignee?

This would be similar to the "Resolve & Close" feature, performing two steps in one.
fields.summary: Add ability to "Resolve & Reassign"
Allow editing of others saved filters

fields.description: For 'other filters' list the creator also.
fields.summary: Separate filters into 'my filters' and 'other filters'

fields.description:
I created a version called "Feruary Release" in a copy of the EAP I downloaded (the standalone).  I then assigned several bugs to that release.  I then realized I had made a spelling error and attempted to delete Feruary and reassign the bugs to February.  When I tried to do this I got the following error:

Delete Version: Feruary release 
Confirm that you want to delete this version, and specify what is to be done with the issues currently matching this version.
 
Form Errors: 
Exception: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.version.VersionDelete@678eb9, result: null
fields.summary: Bug when deleting a version and tranferring bugs to another version

fields.description:
For my configuration there are these workflow actions available (in this order):
* Assign Issue
* Resolve Issue
* Start/Stop Progress

It would be more natural to have them in this order:
* Assign Issue
* Start/Stop Issue
* Resolve Issue
fields.summary: Show available workflow actions in natural order

fields.description:
I've created an attachment successfully (attachment.png). But when I want to view it, no image is shown (cannot-view-attachment.png).

The file was created in the server's attachment folder and is the valid graphic file.
fields.summary: png-Attachments aren't shown any more

fields.description:
I had expected to use the Custom fields to further classify our issues, so we could express more than the priority field alone.

However, in order to do so, it would be necessary to see the custom fields in the issue listings and to sort the issue lists using the custom fields.
Including them in the excel export would also be nice for making viewgraphs of the issue classification.

Are such features planned?
fields.summary: Sort and view custom fields in lists

fields.description: As the attached screenshot shows, there is a link to resolve an already resolved issue, but none to reopen the issue.
fields.summary: Cannot reopen, but resolve an already resolved issue

fields.description:
When you resolve a bug, it should not automatically assign the bug to you.

For example, our testing team opens the bugs, and they close them. We (the developers) don't close the bugs - only the testing team does after they've verified the bug is indeed fixed.

An option in the configuration to change this behaviour would be desirable.
fields.summary: Reassigning bugs on completion should be configurable

fields.description: The search filter needs an option to be able to filter for all bugs commented by a certain person. (I have no idea why our team wants this, but they do)
fields.summary: Need to filter by 'commenter'

fields.description: Our testing team need to be able to add other people to a bug's 'watching' list. We often have a bug that require a few people to know about it.
fields.summary: Need to be able to add others to 'watching' list

fields.description:
One thing they just hit me with though is that an NPE is thrown when the
"to:" line is empty. Not sure why they're doing that, but I've done it
before to mask the list of recipients from the recipients. Anyway,
here's the stacktrace...

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.util.StringTokenizer.<init>(StringTokenizer.java:117)
        at
com.atlassian.jira.service.util.ServiceUtils.findIssueInString(ServiceUt
ils.java:88)
        at
com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.NonQuotedCommentHandler.handleMe
ssage(NonQuote
dCommentHandler.java:48)
fields.summary: Possible NPE

fields.description: A the moment the progress bar makes the page contain too many tables.  Potentially use a servlet to create the image instead of using tables.
fields.summary: Use image servlet for progress bars instead of tables.

fields.description: Is there a reason for this?  If not - we should keep them similar.
fields.summary: Edit issue fields not in the same order as create issue fields
Fix "some text" and other UI on filter subscriptions

fields.description:
As many spammers havest email addresses from websites, provide an option to hide email addresses on the profile pages.

Administrator email addresses may be provided, or maybe just a form that sends email to them instead.
fields.summary: Option to hide email addresses

fields.description:
You've got three at your page but I've entered about 15 (yes I need all of them and even more), and to find right one at this page is not that simple. 

The most simple solution could be just replacing 

Reports: Open Issues | Road Map | Change Log | Popular 

and 

Filter Issues:
- ALL
- Outstanding
- Unscheduled
- Assigned to me
- Reported by me
 - Resolved recently
- Added recently
- Updated recently
- Most important 

by just icons. The actual meaning of an icon could be easily figured out by mouse-over hint.

Another (more complex) enhancement could be to add relation 'user group' -> 'project', and to show only projects linked to user group(s) of current user.
fields.summary: Home page (dashboard) is crowded when there are more than three project

fields.description:
View projects -> select project
Notification Scheme: None (select scheme) 
-> select scheme

ERROR 
It seems that you have tried to perform an operation which you are not permitted to perform. 

If you feel this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions.
fields.summary: Can't assign notification schema to a project

fields.description: The initial screen for creating issues sometimes gets confused and displays itself incorrectly - see http://www.jivesoftware.com/bruce/doublebug.JPG for a visual. Reloading the page fixes the issue.
fields.summary: create issue initial page sometimes gets confused

fields.description:
For our usage of Jira, we need a way to allow customers and managers to quickly view a list issues and reprioritise the stories by promoting/demoting their position in the list.

This is a procedure done in bulk (typically reshuffling the priority of about 20 items at a time) and therefore has to be fast and easy to use.

Currently it is causing a problem because it is too time consuming to go into each issue and edit it, and priorities are rated on a fixed scale (trival->blocker) rather than relative to other issues.
fields.summary: Bulk priority reshuffle

fields.description:
Because we are using the JSSE providers that are shipped with the Sun JDK, JIRA's encoding & decoding of the license does not work on IBM JDK.

You will see the following exceptions in your logs:

Exception looking up public key: no such provider: SUN
java.security.NoSuchProviderException: no such provider: SUN

The line that needs to be changed is:

KeyFactory keyFactory = KeyFactory.getInstance("DSA", "SUN");

Perhaps we can remove the explicit call to "SUN".
fields.summary: JIRA does not run on IBM JDK.

fields.description: I'm new to JIRA, perhaps this feature exists but I couldn't find it.
fields.summary: Ability to Edit Comments

fields.description:
One of our developers ran into this issue, and I now also ran into it.

I have a new issue in a project, and the project has no versions in it.  I'm assigned the issue, and I go to resolve it.  When I click resolve, I pick a resolution type, and then select "None" for versions.  I then enter a comment.

When I click resolve, I get a red form error box with a BLANK bullet.  There is no additional text.  I check that the "None" field is clicked, which it is.  I really make no changes to the form.  I then click RESOLVE, and the issue seems to successfully resolve.

My workflow on the form now says "Assign Issue" and "Reopen Issue".  However, the status on the top left of the issue still says "Assigned", indicating that the issue has NOT been resolved.

My comment is NOT added to the issue, but my workflow indiciates it has changed.  If I view the workflow tab I see the following:

Adam Harvey [ Start: Today 09:35 AM End: Today 12:06 PM ]  
Status: Finished
Action Name (from WF): (id: 1)
Step Name (from WF): (id: 3)
 
Adam Harvey [ Start: Today 09:35 AM End: Today 09:35 AM ]  
Status: Finished
Action Name (from WF): (id: 201)
Step Name (from WF): (id: 2) 

At this point, the issue is quite messed up, as no one can resolve the issue.  It can only be reassigned or closed from an assigned status.  I don't have a specific use case to reproduce, but I think this should suffice.
fields.summary: Problem resolving issues, workflow gets corrupted

fields.description:
I have all permissions for a project and still i don't see "Fix for version" when selecting Edit for an issue. We have defines some versions for this project.

I see this problem only in one project. In other projects I see "Fix for version".
fields.summary: Don't see "Fix for version" when selecting Edit for an issue

fields.description: It would be helpful to have an ability to change the name of an existing version.
fields.summary: Ability to change version name

fields.description:
Put "localhost" in for smtp server (and nothing for JNDI lookup), and no mail gets sent, no error messages (that I could see) generated.

Put "ff.yy.com" in (the same server), and it works.

Maybe this is something specific to my system since I'm surprised noone's reported it before.

Localhost and local (same-domain) names ought to be used as valid servers.

Also, "127.0.0.1" did not work either for smtp server.  Whether the actual IP address would work I'm not sure, I didn't try it.
fields.summary: 'localhost' not recognized as valid smtp server

fields.description:
A way to link file attachments to comments would be very useful. Or to upload a file attachment into a comment. 

e.g. "Here is the new file". But currently you have to upload it into the attachments section. So you would have to say "The new file is abc.txt"

Instead it would be more convenient if you could the file in the comment. "Here is the new file" and then the user could just click it below, instead of searching for it under "attachments". I mean because what if there are 5 slightly different copies of the file? So each attachment right now would have to say abc-rev1.txt abc-rev2.txt etc.

Hopefully I made some sense. Thanks for listening.
fields.summary: Link File Attachments to Comments

fields.description:
Often future version get misorderd as new point version are rapidly created. Currently, we have to select the future version and click "Later" button over and over to get it to the bottom of the list. 

Two new buttons/actions would nice for this page:

  "^^ First" and "vv Last"
fields.summary: Schedule version "last/first" buttons

fields.description: I have setup a custom field of type "Text < 255". But when I enter a default value, the default is truncted to 61 characters.
fields.summary: Default for custom field is getting truncated

fields.description: shouldn't it show the priorities configured for your installation?
fields.summary: help page on create issue / priority gives default priority descriptions

fields.description:
I am worried about the user management scheme. say i have 3 projects, 9 users, and three roles (pm,developer,user). and for each role and project i have one person assigned. Meaning Project A has one developer, one pm, and one user. And Project B has a different developer, pm, and user. This means i have to create 9 groups to effectively isolate and manage permissions. If the number of projects i create grows to 10, i now have 30 groups, 20users. 20 projs, 60 groups, 60users. This is growing quickly.

What if for each project i created series of roles ( developer, pm, user). These roles could be shared across projects.  And for each project, i assigned users to a role. and with those roles i controlled permissions for the individual projects.

Now, continuing my example from above, in the case of 20 projects i have 3 roles, 60 users.

Iam interested in your opion on this.
fields.summary: User-Group-Project

fields.description:
We have a large number of projects that we are tracking here. And the home page for an individual user is growing in length quite rapidly.  It would be nice if users could choose which projects they see at a given time on there home page.  A "Edit My Home Page" screen would be nice.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Too many projects on the home page

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1158]. {panel} I'm going through a users document, and against each paragraph I'm adding a hyperlink into the appropriate jira issue (e.g. http://blah.com:1234/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=GBL-65) it would be nice if I could include an image (i.e. ) where XXX is a url like http://blah.com:1234/secure/status.gif?key=GBL-65 and the status.gif changes depending on the status i.e. resolved/open etc that way this document would accurately reflect the current open/closed status of each paragraph in her original document (could be security problems)
fields.summary: Current Issue Status As Image

fields.description: I've deleted some user groups.  However, I had those user groups defined in some of the tasks within the global permission.  Those tasks still have the deleted user groups defined, and when I try to delete them from the task, it complains about group 'Foo' does not exist.
fields.summary: Global permission do not delete obsolete user groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1156].
  {panel}

We need better statistics on defects and new features by projects.  Your project query today only displays status by priority.  We need to see quantities of defects by state.  Attached is our weekly status report.  PLease see below: 

Feature/Defect Deliverables	Who	Total	UA	20%	40%	60%	Done
SMH Feature/Defects	Rich	41	39	0	0	2	2
Eagle Feature/Defects	Thuyen	123	0	20	20	24	79
AMMO Reported defects	Josh	658 (630)	14	52
(72)	108
(158)	133
(75)	351 (325)
AMMO New Features	Josh	151	15	27	63	21	24

Legend
UA	UnAssigned	Done	Closed
20%	Requirements clarification	(XX)	Prior Week
40%	Assigned to development
60%	Resolved
Progress

The statues we use are unassigned, assigned, resolved, closed.  We report weekly a breakdown between bug and new feature.  Also we want to compare this weeks results to last weeks results.  I can send you the report in WORD if you give me an e-mail.  To do this report I have to execute about 20 queries.  rich
fields.summary: Improve summary Project queries

fields.description:
We need to fix up the POP Service to take in the name of a configured POP
server, rather than raw details.
fields.summary: Change POPService to ask for configured pop server

fields.description: I'm using EAP 2.0.4.  I tried to remove permission group "Anyone" in one of the permission fields for one of the projects I've created.  It complains about group "Anyone" does not exist.
fields.summary: Cannot delete permission group "Anyone" in the per-project permission page

fields.description:
Use Case
1) Create a group in the group browser
2) Apply this group to the Assignable Users permissions in the Global Permissions section of the admin tool
3) Set Allow Unassigned to FALSE
4) Go back to the group browser and delete the group
5) Create a new issue

The field "Assigned to:" in the create issue form will be a broken drop down box.  You will also find if you go back to Global Permissions that the group name you deleted is still marked on the global permissions fields.  You must recreate the group of the same name, then remove from all global permissions, then go delete it.

Deleting a group should clean up the global permission settings.
fields.summary: Problems when deleting group used in global permissions

fields.description:
Issue numbers are not shown on the full content view. Only the issue title is displayed. It makes sense to show the number (on printouts) as this is the main way to indentify and communicate about issues.

Suggestion: Just put the issue number in front of the title.
fields.summary: Full content view does not contain issue numbers

fields.description: On the frontpage the "New user" signup button is wrongly displayed when external user management is enabled. In that case users cannot create signup, but are created in the external user management system. This sgnup button should be removed in this case.
fields.summary: User signup button wrongly displayed when external user management is enabled

fields.description:
Link from dashboard (http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa) to Jira's "Added recently" links here:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10240&createdPrevious=604800000&sorter/field=datecreated&sorter/order=DESC

However, it is listed in ascending date order.  It seems that "DESC" isn't really descending?
fields.summary: Incorrect sort order on Issue Navigator

fields.description: When creating a filter, if you select the calendar popup for dates and times and choose a different month, today's date is ALWAYS highlighted, even for other months.  Not sure if this was intended or not, but it is a tad confusing to see November 21th highlighted, when it's January 21th.
fields.summary: Filter calendar popup always highlight today's date, regardless of month

fields.description:
I created a new notification scheme as my user "admin" in "administrators" group in 2.0, and then tried to apply it to a project.  I keep getting a red "error" box with "It seems that you have tried to perform an operation which you are not permitted to perform", on a page titled "SECURITY BREACH".

My global permissions are like so:

JIRA Admins - administrators
JIRA Users - Anyone
Project Administrators - managers

And my admin user is NOT a member of the managers group.  I also tried adding administrators to the Project Administrators section, to no avail.  (Yes, I renamed my groups via an import/export edit.)
fields.summary: Unable to apply notification scheme to project

fields.description:
If a logged in user does not have ANY browse permissions, the "Saved Filters" box could be hidden from their view.

You must check for no browse permissions in order to show the, "You do not have the permissions required to browse any projects" message.  So you could also just hide the filters box.

Also, if they have CREATE permissions, could the red box note this some how?  Perhaps provide a link to create?
fields.summary: Hide "Saved Filters" if user does not have any browse permissions

fields.description:
The date header is missing from the email generated by Jira.

E.g. there is no line like

   Date: Mon, 20 Jan 2003 17:57:02 +0100

set in the email.

This is no problem for most email programs like Outlook, but for some email programs (like Mozilla 1.2) this gives troubles. Mozilla will give this Jira email a default date like 31-12-1969. As consequence the email only shows up in the bottom of your inbox, which one would not notice that easy.

The Javamail API has the method to set the date, and I think this method should be used in Jira. Please also see the smtp RFC.

This also happens in email generated by OSS projects that use Jira.
fields.summary: Generated email notifications have no date header

fields.description:
I have been screwing around with the priorities (adding, removing, renaming, reordering). I'm now back to the default except with "trivial" renamed to "smell". But when click the on the priority in a table, medium is being sorted above high.

Looking at the database I see that priorty sequences seem to be correct (blocker 1.000 .. smell 5.000). But the sorting is consistent with the priorities ID column, which in my case is:

1 block 
2 medium
5 high
6 low
7 smell

Also, the arrow in the column header points down when the higher priorities are at the top, and up when the lower priorities are at the top. Is the normal?
fields.summary: Priority sorting not consistent with priority ordering

fields.description: Often I create new issues while viewing the list of issues for a specific component. It would be nice if there were a link to create an issue using the current context as the defaults (in this case the currently viewed component).
fields.summary: "Quick" create new issue for component

fields.description:
> I also have a question about issue filtering: We're running
> multiple development projects. We're using an XP methodology,
> which schedules development in small chunks, called iterations.
> So Project ABC and XYZ both have a version called "Iteration-10,"
> and it represents the same two weeks of development.
> 
> We would like to be able to filter by "All Projects" and by
> version "Iteration-10," and thus show us every task we need to
> accomplish in this two week iteration, regardless of which
> project it is in. This is not possible now, so far as I can see.
> Is there anyway to make this happen, either now or in 2.0?

Right - hrm, file a feature request on jira.atlassian.com for it. It's a little tricky to do with the current architecture (as two components with the same name really have nothing to do with each other in the data model), I'll have to think about how to do it.
fields.summary: Versions that Cross Projects

fields.description:
When you sort by key and the arrow points down, the issues are ordered from the highest number to the lowest number.

When you sort by Summary and the arrow points down, the issues are ordered from the Z's to the A's

When you sort by priority and the arrow points down, the issues are sorted from the lowest priority to the highest! This seems backwards to me.
fields.summary: Sorting by priority seems backwards

fields.description:
Select a named filter. Click the 'edit' link. Then immidiately click the 'view and hide' button. 

The filter name panel now has the message "Current filter modified since loading" even though it was never changed.
fields.summary: Show/hide filter with no change is indicated as being changed

fields.description: Seems that all other selection values are displayed in the summary except the project value.
fields.summary: Filter summary should indicate the project scope

fields.description:
After renaming some priorities and add a new ones, the priority selection list in the filter panel reflected the superset of renamed/added priorities. Performing a find using priorities yields:

An error occurred searching: com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchException

The strange part is that the error only seemed to occur when the scope as 'all projects' and not for the any of the new/renamed priorities, but for blockers (the most important priority to search for across all projects).
fields.summary: CRUD of priorities is not reflected in filter selection list

fields.description:
In Find Issues, searching on numbers in Summary and Description always returns 0 results.
Try searching on "8n"
fields.summary: Search on numbers does not work

fields.description: In EAP 6, the width of the send test mail page is fixed and is wider than 1024 which causes an horizontal scrollbar to appear.
fields.summary: Width of Send test mail page
Ability to modify Group NAme

fields.description:
If I mistakenly log, for example, 6 days time spent instead of 6 hours, there is apparently no way to correct the error. I can't delete the log entry, I can't edit the log entry, I can't enter negative time in a new log entry to adjust the total.

I appear to be stuck with an issue that will report as 5 days and 2 hours more time spent than is true. This will be unacceptable to my manager, requiring an explanation by me to him, by him to his manager, etc.

Please give me an Edit Work Log Entry feature.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Can't correct typos in time spent.

fields.description:
If you load one of your own saved filters and then change the sort order of the results the filter appears to be modified.  This is correct but when you go to save the filter the fact that you have changed the sort order is not displayed as part of the comparison with the old filter.

It would be nice to see the current sort order(s) when the filter is saved.
fields.summary: Display sort order when saving a filter
